intro: Sonerila balasubramaniamii, commonly known as the Balasubramaniam’s sonerila, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant is shrub-like, with simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
